intro: Sciadotenia cayennensis, commonly known as the Cayenne thornapple, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It is often found in dry, open habitats and can thrive in poor soil conditions. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
